Class SongLinkedList

  • java.lang.Object
    • SongLinkedList

  • public class SongLinkedList
extends java.lang.Object
    The SongLinkedList class represent the whole Doubly-Linked List class that holds Song object as data for each node. It contains a head to represent the first SongNode of the doubly-linked list, it contains a tail to represent the last SongNode of the doubly-linked list, it also contains a cursor to point to certain SongNode. The SongLinkedList will have size variable to keep track of the elements that it have in it's link

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SongLinkedList()
      Default constructor of the SongLinkedList, all of the values are set to default, the head, tail, and cursor will all be set to null and the size will be set to 0 because there is no element in the Linked-List in the beginning

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cursorBackwards()
      Moves the cursor to point at the previous SongNode, this is also a part of user's main way of moving around the Linked List
      void cursorForwards()
      Moves the cursor to point at the next SongNode, it is a part of the user's main way of moving around the Linked List
      void deleteAll()
      This will simply delete all of the songs from the playlist
      SongNode getHead()
      Returns the head SongNode of the SongLinkedList, in other words the first element of the list
      int getSize()
      Returns the size of the SongLinkedList
      SongNode getTail()
      Returns the tail SongNode of the SongLinkedList, in other words the last element of the list
      void insertAfterCursor(Song newSong)
      Inserts a song into the playlist after the cursor position, if there is no song in the playlist then it will just add it to the playlist and update all of the pointer variable including head, tail, cursor, and size accordingly
      boolean isClipRunning()
      This method will determine whether or not the Clip c that is being used by the SongLinkedList is playing or inactive.
      void play(java.lang.String name)
      This method plays the song indicated by name.
      void printPlayerList()
      Prints the playlist in a neatly-formatted table.
      Song random()
      Selects one of the songs in the playlist and play it at random.
      Song removeCursor()
      Remove the SongNode referenced by the cursor and returns the Song contained within the node
      void shuffle()
      Randomly shuffles the order of the songs contained within the playlist
      void stopClip()
      This method will stop the Clip c that is used by the SongLinkedList from playing
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a neatly formatted String representation of the playlist

    • Constructor Detail

      • SongLinkedList

        public SongLinkedList()
        Default constructor of the SongLinkedList, all of the values are set to default, the head, tail, and cursor will all be set to null and the size will be set to 0 because there is no element in the Linked-List in the beginning

    • Method Detail

      • getHead

        public SongNode getHead()
        Returns the head SongNode of the SongLinkedList, in other words the first element of the list
        Returns:
        Returns head, which is the first element of the list

      • getTail

        public SongNode getTail()
        Returns the tail SongNode of the SongLinkedList, in other words the last element of the list
        Returns:
        Returns tail, which is the last element of the the list

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of the SongLinkedList
        Returns:
        Returns a int that represent the size of the list or the total elements that is in the SongLinkedList

      • play

        public void play(java.lang.String name)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method plays the song indicated by name. It will stop any song before playing a new song

        Precondition: The name must match an actual song name in the playlist and there must be a file associated with it

        Postcondition: The song is now playing

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the song to play
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - IllegalArgumentException is thrown to indicate that the provided name does not correspond to a song in the playlist, or that the wav file could not be found.

      • isClipRunning

        public boolean isClipRunning()
        This method will determine whether or not the Clip c that is being used by the SongLinkedList is playing or inactive.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Clip C is running and false if the Clip is not running

      • stopClip

        public void stopClip()
        This method will stop the Clip c that is used by the SongLinkedList from playing

        Precondition: Clip c must be instantiated

        Postcondition: The clip is stopped

      • cursorForwards

        public void cursorForwards()
        Moves the cursor to point at the next SongNode, it is a part of the user's main way of moving around the Linked List

        Precondition: The list is not empty, cursor is not null

        Postcondition: The cursor has been advanced to the next SongNode, or has remained at the tail of the list

      • cursorBackwards

        public void cursorBackwards()
        Moves the cursor to point at the previous SongNode, this is also a part of user's main way of moving around the Linked List

        Precondition: The list is not empty, cursor is not null

        Postcondition: The cursor has been moved back to the previous SongNode, or has remained at the head of the list

      • insertAfterCursor

        public void insertAfterCursor(Song newSong)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Inserts a song into the playlist after the cursor position, if there is no song in the playlist then it will just add it to the playlist and update all of the pointer variable including head, tail, cursor, and size accordingly

        Precondition: The newSong object has been instantiated

        Postcondition: The new Song is inserted into the playlist after the position of the cursor. All Song objects previously in the playlist are still in the playlist, and the order of the playlist is preserved. The cursor now points to the inserted node

        Parameters:
        newSong - The Song to be inserted into the playlist
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - IllegalArgumentException is thrown to indicate that newSong is null

      • removeCursor

        public Song removeCursor()
        Remove the SongNode referenced by the cursor and returns the Song contained within the node

        Precondition: The cursor is not null

        Postcondition: The SongNode referenced by the cursor has been removed from the playlist. And the cursor now references the next node, or if there is no next node then references to the previous node

        Returns:
        Returns the Song that is contained within the removed node

      • random

        public Song random()
        Selects one of the songs in the playlist and play it at random. It will not change the order of the playlist

        Postcondition: The randomly selected song is now playing

        Returns:
        The Song which was randomly picked

      • shuffle

        public void shuffle()
        Randomly shuffles the order of the songs contained within the playlist

        Postcondition: The playlist is randomly reordererd. Cursor should reference the SongNode which contains the same Song as when this method was entered

      • printPlayerList

        public void printPlayerList()
        Prints the playlist in a neatly-formatted table. This is using the toString method of the SongLinkedList to print the rest of the tablar form

      • deleteAll

        public void deleteAll()
        This will simply delete all of the songs from the playlist

        Postcondition: All songs have been removed

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a neatly formatted String representation of the playlist
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns a neatly formatted String representing the playlist in tabular form
